website_summaries.verdict: Construction-focused MetalliScanner detects ferrous (magnetic) metals and non-ferrous (non-magnetic) metals buried in concrete, drywall, plaster, and other materials.
pros: Find nails, wires and other metallic objects in wood, drywall, paneling, tile, stucco, plaster, concrete, and other non-metallic surfaces
Operates as a stud-finder for renovation and construction work
Detects ferrous metal up to 4 inches and non-ferrous metal up to 2 inches deep
Use this detector to locate plumbing, ductwork, rebar, nails, and screws in walls, floors, and ceilings
cons: Readings can be frustrating, with false-positive signals

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed with its ability to find broken off cut ...
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with its ability to find broken off cut nails in some 120+ year old reclaimed timbers I bought. I need to get any iron pieces that are less than 1/2" below the surface of the timbers so I can plane and surface the timbers for use in a workbench I plan on building. This is working perfectly. Since it will likely never be used again after this project, price was important. I was worried something this inexpensive would not work very well, but am very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: It's amazing how many metal items you forget are close by ...
customer_reviews.text: A welcome partner in the shop. After a few months of use, we trust it to find metal in wood, etc. Range is hard to tell, but if we are trying to measure close to anything with a screw in it (like a work table or something we are wearing) it will wink withing 7-8 inches or further and absolutely light up inside of 4-5 inches. Fooled us a few times, until we realized it was reading anything close. We are now trained to use it away from all things but the item we are scanning. It's amazing how many metal items you forget are close by in a shop/work space. Recommend This One
customer_reviews.author: Eric Hyde

customer_reviews.title: Works with lath and plaster. That's good enough for me.
customer_reviews.text: I live in an old Craftsman with mostly lath and plaster. My plain-Jane stud finder can't penetrate these old walls. But the m40 makes quick work of it. Important to note you should read instructions. This device calibrates differently than others I've used. Hold the button while the m40 is AWAY from the wall and anything metallic for the most sensitive calibration. Change orientation of it for pinpoint measuring. ...And there are a few other bits which add to learning curve the uninitiated will likely misinterpret as this being a crappy finder. It's not. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Dreifort

customer_reviews.title: this is quite simply the best so far
customer_reviews.text: 12 years in the trades, used all types of finders, this is quite simply the best so far. Unpackaged the unit, spent 3 minutes with the directions, and I went to work. It cut though 1/4" tile over 1/2" drywall like butter to give accurate readings - very very very impressed. If you haven't spent a lot of time with finders, setup a practice field with an old piece of drywall attached over some scrap lumber to get the feel of how this unit behaves. Learn to calibrate, to use the gross field sensor, as well as the spot isolation sensor. Zircon also has some vids on YouTube. I highly recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia

customer_reviews.title: Works great as a scanner or if you run into some Klingons
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this tool. It is the only one that I have found that zeroes in on both lath nails and drywall screws with such precision. Also works great on copper wire and so on if you can get close enough (although, I suppose that could be a false positive if you're not paying attention. I wish it was USB rechargeable because I know I'll one day get stuck without a now-harder-to-find 9V but I'm not sure how long the battery will last so that might be a non issue. Also looks pretty funky so everyone is always like "WTF is that thing?" so I just tell them its a phaser so stay away.
customer_reviews.author: LLWarrenP

customer_reviews.title: Works on lathe & plaster walls - and drywall!
customer_reviews.text: Got this to help mount my TV on the wall as well as locate studs to run network cable through. Our living room has lathe and plaster and this thing found the studs almost immediately. Just keep in mind it's basically a metal detector so it will pickup most metal objects in your wall (such as piping or electrical wire). The "pinpoint" accuracy mode is also helpful in avoiding nails when driving screws through the wall. This also worked well in our rooms with drywall as I was able to locate the drywall screws as well.
customer_reviews.author: Cody S.

customer_reviews.title: It detected metal accurately (but for that one room)
customer_reviews.text: I decided to keep it, as it seemed to aid me finding studs except for one room in my home. I checked it in other rooms, and it seemed to work perfectly. I purposefully aimed it at metal objects and it would notify me right away. That one room was odd though, where any time I scanned the wall anywhere, it would notify me. I suspect that it would work grand in newer homes. I don't know whether that warrants five stars, so I'll give it four because it seems to detect metal with accuracy in most places.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.title: Does A Superb Job At An Excellent Price!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to locate an unused galvanized pipe installed somewhere in my walls 25 years ago during my home's construction for use as the feed line for a future gas fireplace. Because my basement is now finished, I couldn't find find the pipe's origins in the basement. This device allowed me to easily locate the pipe behind the wall as it went through the first floor of my house, making it much simpler to determine where the capped-off pipe enters my basement. This project would have been nearly impossible without it. Easily found pipe through sheetrock without having to make any holes!
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Kurtz

customer_reviews.title: 100% trash!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is trash. Out the box dont work. The instructions doesn't tell you what a steady slow beep is. Changed the battery and still the same thing. Absolutely nothing. This is my third Zircon product and only had one that worked well for about a year. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Gadams

customer_reviews.title: Go for it!
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate, easy to calibrate for varying needs, lighting is well thought out, bright yellow makes it easy to find, rubber on grip makes it harder to drop, high quality plastic should survive minor drops, you won't find it cheaper anywhere else. Well worth the $. FOLLOW UP: I've been using this a few weeks removing nail and screw infested slab siding (the heads were hidden with caulking). It surpasses my expectations after learning how to fine tune the search precisely. To anyone with complaints about this tool... Read the directions!
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Sufi

customer_reviews.title: plaster walls
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product after trying (and failing) to use a regular stud finder on my plaster and lath walls. With the stud finder I was getting inconsistent and contradictory results. With the MetalliScanner it took a bit to get the hang of it, but it was fairly consistent and with a few passes I was able to figure it out and get the bracket for my closet shelf rehung.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Nolden

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work
customer_reviews.text: I got some wood recently and ran into a couple nails right off the bat cutting it down. Ordered this and now check every piece before I start milling. It hasn't caught a nail yet, but only because (hopefully) there weren't any to catch. Tests on metal do work and it seems fairly sensitive. Nice addition to the shop and if it saves one saw blade it pays for itself.
customer_reviews.author: BinDC

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Here's how to make it even more precise if you skipped the instructions.
customer_reviews.text: If you skip reading the instructions, note that when you hold down the trigger to calibrate when not near metal, it calibrates to a higher sensitivity. When you hold down the trigger near metal, it calibrates to a lower sensitivity to help you more precisely find metal spots!
customer_reviews.author: John Needham

customer_reviews.title: Works through bathroom tile
customer_reviews.text: Used it to locate studs under shower bathroom tile. Identified screws that held the concrete board onto the studs. Purpose: attach grab bars to studs. Worked well. I'm a handy-man home-owner. I have limited use, but for what I wanted, it worked. Recommended. I also see potential for scanning old lumber for metal before machining. I do woodworking.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Maddock

customer_reviews.title: It succeeds where most others fail.
customer_reviews.text: This worls exactly as described. I have an 1840s house. Some walls are plaster and lathe, some are plaster board, some are wood, some are drywall, some are all four and most are a combination of at least two... nothing else worked until this. This is easily one of the most appreciated tools that I own now.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Mine was broken upon delivery

customer_reviews.author: dp

customer_reviews.title: Lather and plaster solution
customer_reviews.text: Had a previous electronic stud finder that never found a stud in my flat, a '20s building in SF with lathe and plaster walls. Found two studs for hanging a large and heavy painting w/in a couple minutes with this, very simple to use. Hammering the nails in it felt like the stud itself was 1" behind the plaster and this had still located them clearly. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Blatherskyte

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for finding studs in plaster walls (and drywall too)
customer_reviews.text: In plaster walls, the nails give away the location of the stud (given the lathes)... other detectors dont work well (especially if there is paneling over it also). This is a metal detector and ONLY that... but it works well. But also, drywall studs can be found the same way (though there are way less nails/screws).
customer_reviews.author: Ann P

customer_reviews.title: Works great on plaster walls
customer_reviews.text: My house is older and has plaster walls. Since traditional stud finders don't work I decided to try this tool. I love it! Very easy to use and understand, and accurate. The only thing I'd note is that if you need to identify metal pipes, etc then you will want a more advanced tool that can tell you the difference between a stud and plumbing. But for basic stud finding so you can hang shelves/pictures/whatever, this tool will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra C.

customer_reviews.title: Best Stud-finder Ever
customer_reviews.text: For the past 2 years while working on my daughters home trying to hang pictures , shelves etc has been a guessing game. I used conventional stud finders , magnets nothing worked well. I recently purchased this product and literally found all the studs in a room in an 1860 home with Hoarse Hair Plaster , Lattes & Wall Paper . The product worked exceptional.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Works so far
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have lath and plaster walls in my appartment. This is a metal detector. Instructions are well explained on how to use it. At some spots it picks up better signal then others. I guess it depends on the mass of the plaster and what metal object is behind it. I guess this is as good as it gets for the price.
customer_reviews.author: BH

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says it'll do

customer_reviews.title: Well made tool

customer_reviews.title: if you've never used something like it. Simple instruction and it works extremely well ...

customer_reviews.author: Chuck R

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good tool for a home inspector
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my home inspection business, particularly for doing wind mitigation inspection in Florida. You have to locate nails in the roofing rafters/trusses. The device works pretty good on the wide angle (low accuracy) scan, but does not work so well in the precision mode. When you aim the fine point probe at the truss, the coarse scanner is pointing up at the roof, and "sees" all the shingle nails. Other than that little foible it works pretty good. I can find rebar or wiring in a block wall with stucco. And the case is pretty tough, too, having dropped it with no damage whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: TerryD

customer_reviews.title: Opened Package

customer_reviews.title: Its accuracy.

This metal detector found all the nails to within an 1/8 inch or less - including the one that missed the stud! Got all the lag screws into the studs. Very pleased with performance.
customer_reviews.author: Roger S Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Finally!  Something that works on plaster walls in my house!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely simple to use. This is the first product I have ever had that consistently and reliably actually finds studs, which are never where they should be, in my 70 year old house behind plaster walls. You will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Perry Del Rossi

customer_reviews.title: It works great tool to have.
customer_reviews.text: Nice to have this in tool box can find nails in studs ok and in plaster . Older construction may have issues with metal screen on plaster along wall but worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: ANDRE HOLMES

customer_reviews.title: Worked for my lathe and plaster walls
customer_reviews.text: I was having a heck of a time finding the studs in my Lathe and Plaster wall, a regular stud finder does not work so I had to ask a friend for help. On his suggestion, I purchased this. This works by detecting metal in the walls - lath boards are secured by nails (metal); they are nailed into the studs. What I did was run this across my wall, I marked with tape where it detected metal. I ended up with a more or less of a grid, but I could now easily see where the studs were. FINALLY, a way to find studs in lathe and plaster!

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS!

The directions are almost non-existent so it may be due in part to user error. It isn't consistently detecting any metal in the wall where I am trying to install my closet brackets. It will light up briefly, but never in the same place twice. It picks up my wedding ring and the metal closet brackets just fine, so I know it's functioning, but it's frustrating not being able to find a stud, wiring, or anything else in the wall.

As long as I am careful I can find all the bits of metal that would chip my sawblades. The self calibration works great, as does the pinpoint function. A 9v alkaline battery lasts a long time. I haven't tried it but I am confident this will also work great for finding nails, pipes, wires etc. in walls. Excellent accuracy and durability for the price point!

Other metal detectors can work but this one gets the nails spot on. Even better though is its ability to detect non ferrous metal like more modern nails that may have been broken off in the boards. This detector worked well for finding those too. Very satisfied with this tool for this job.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for plaster walls.
customer_reviews.text: This is the only stud finder I could find that would come close to finding studs in our old house. Every so often I'll run into a section of wall that I can't really get any signal on this finder, but it's pretty rare. I've also had it go haywire in areas that I know there's some plumbing, which i guess makes sense. Overall pretty good, better than constantly punching holes in the plaster looking for studs.

product_meta.title: Zircon MetalliScanner m40- Handheld Electronic Metal Detector Use on Dry Wall, Concrete, Lathe and Plaster, Stucco and More, Battery Included
product_meta.description: Product Packaging:Frustration-Free PackagingThe Zircon MetalliScanner m40 electronic metal scanner quickly and easily detects metal in lath and plaster, wood, drywall, paneling, tile, stucco, plaster, concrete and other non-metallic surfaces. This metal detector locates ferrous (magnetic) metal up to 4 inches (100 mm) deep and non-ferrous (non-magnetic) metal up to 2 inches (50 mm) deep. The Zircon m40 has two scanning positions, Wide Scan and Pinpoint Scan. To get started, install the included 9V alkaline battery. Hold the tool in the air away from any metal but make sure the blue sensor is parallel to the surface being scanned. Press and hold the Power Button to calibrate the unit. Once you hear a beep and see the green "Ready" LED illuminated, calibration is complete. Continue to hold the Power Button as you slowly slide the tool across the surface. As the MetalliScanner approaches a metal object, the red LEDs progressively light from the bottom up in both scanning modes. The top lighted blue coil and an audio tone indicate when a metal target is located. This MetalliScanner m40 tool easily solves the very difficult problem of finding studs in lath and plaster walls. It works as a nail finder by detecting the pattern of nails that attach the wood lath to the studs. Additionally, the MetalliScanner m40 metal locator finds plumbing, ductwork, rebar, nails and screws in your walls, floors and ceilings and is great for scanning reclaimed lumber for hidden metal. Now in easy open packaging, this product comes with everything you need to get started, including the battery! Backed by our world class customer service and support, we at Zircon know that whether you're a Construction Professional or weekend DIY enthusiast, you'll find the m40 has the technology and durability you're looking for to get the job done right.
